update.title: [Acropolis] Adding a bound box feature

content.raw:
Grey's solution seems to be the best we can do with just the OOBB (i.e. without calculating a new minimum bounding box based on the rotated shape). I'm good with this solution.
,
content.html: Grey's solution seems to be the best we can do with just the OOBB (i.e. without calculating a new minimum bounding box based on the rotated shape). I'm good with this solution. ,

content.raw: Given that the AABB feature in ign-gazebo isn't shipping today, I would propose holding off on this as well, since there's still some active discussion happening, and I haven't had a chance to digest it all.
content.html: Given that the AABB feature in ign-gazebo isn't shipping today, I would propose holding off on this as well, since there's still some active discussion happening, and I haven't had a chance to digest it all.

content.raw: The box's center is at (0, 0,  -0.5). The z values for the corners should be -0.5 - 0.5 and -0.5 + 0.5.
content.html: The box's center is at (0, 0, -0.5). The z values for the corners should be -0.5 - 0.5 and -0.5 + 0.5.

content.raw: ~~Instead of transforming the `_box` corners, can we just return `Quantity(_box.min(), _box.max())`?~~ This doesn't work.
content.html: Instead of transforming the _box corners, can we just return Quantity(_box.min(), _box.max())? This doesn't work.

content.raw: ~~I'm also confused by the z values for the box. Shouldn't they be -0.5 and 0.5 instead of 0 and 1?~~ I missed the model pose offset in the SDF file.
content.html: I'm also confused by the z values for the box. Shouldn't they be -0.5 and 0.5 instead of 0 and 1? I missed the model pose offset in the SDF file.

update.description:
I'm creating this PR to get initial feedback from the physics experts. My need is bounding box information for models, links, collisions. I don't know if this is the correct approach.

update.title: [Acropolis] Adding a bound box feature

content.raw: That would be great.
content.html: That would be great.

content.raw:
It’s not clear to me that users would always want a shape’s bounding box in the world frame, so this may be a good place to put frame semantics. We could still have it default to using the world frame.

I can also add this in a PR.
content.html:
It’s not clear to me that users would always want a shape’s bounding box in the world frame, so this may be a good place to put frame semantics. We could still have it default to using the world frame.

I can also add this in a PR.

content.raw:
I hate to say it, but this is not the correct way to transform an axis-aligned bounding box from one frame to another.

To illustrate this, suppose you have the yellow box below:

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/5q9rMzd/images/3406174930-bounding.png)
‌

The current method would return the red box, but to have an axis-aligned bounding box of yellow, we really want the green box.

I can create a fix for this and open a PR.
content.html:
I hate to say it, but this is not the correct way to transform an axis-aligned bounding box from one frame to another.

To illustrate this, suppose you have the yellow box below:

‌

The current method would return the red box, but to have an axis-aligned bounding box of yellow, we really want the green box.

I can create a fix for this and open a PR.

content.raw: That's a really good suggestion. Looks like there is still a bug in the implementation. I'm working on it.
content.html: That's a really good suggestion. Looks like there is still a bug in the implementation. I'm working on it.

content.raw: yeah, but there is no `ShapeFeature_TEST` yet, so I just stuck it in here for expediency
content.html: yeah, but there is no ShapeFeature_TEST yet, so I just stuck it in here for expediency

content.raw: a bounding box for a sphere is invariant of its rotation; maybe we should rotate the ground box by 45 degrees in yaw?
content.html: a bounding box for a sphere is invariant of its rotation; maybe we should rotate the ground box by 45 degrees in yaw?

content.raw:
I made a some changes:

* 230d2cb: Avoid using `frames.at()` to prevent a segfault when the function is called on a removed shape
* 193af0a: Fix conversion from local to world frame. Adding a rotation to the sphere in `falling.world` caused the test to fail and led me to the fix. I left the rotation in there since it doesn't break other tests. 

It would be nice to move the bounding box tests to `ShapeFeatures_TEST` at some point, but not a critical right now.
content.html:
I made a some changes:

  • 230d2cb: Avoid using frames.at() to prevent a segfault when the function is called on a removed shape
  • 193af0a: Fix conversion from local to world frame. Adding a rotation to the sphere in falling.world caused the test to fail and led me to the fix. I left the rotation in there since it doesn't break other tests.

It would be nice to move the bounding box tests to ShapeFeatures_TEST at some point, but not a critical right now.

update.title: [Acropolis] Adding a bound box feature

content.raw: I'm having second thoughts on this. Returning the bounding box in the world coordinate frame might be better. I currently don't know how to get the correct transform of a DART shape.
content.html: I'm having second thoughts on this. Returning the bounding box in the world coordinate frame might be better. I currently don't know how to get the correct transform of a DART shape.

content.raw: I was assuming local coordinate frame in `ign-physics`, and then downstream users that need it in a different frame can do the conversion. Does that sounds reasonable?
content.html: I was assuming local coordinate frame in ign-physics, and then downstream users that need it in a different frame can do the conversion. Does that sounds reasonable?

content.raw: do we want this to be in the local coordinate frame? it depends on the application, but I can think of at least one that is relevant to ign-gazebo (broad phase collision detection) that wants it to be in the world frame
content.html: do we want this to be in the local coordinate frame? it depends on the application, but I can think of at least one that is relevant to ign-gazebo (broad phase collision detection) that wants it to be in the world frame
